title: Complaints and Provision of Quail
summary: Numbers 11 describes how the Israelites complain about hardships and crave meat. God provides quail but also sends a plague as judgment. Moses, overwhelmed by the burden of leadership, is given seventy elders to help him govern.

faq.question: Why did God send quail and a plague?
faq.answer: The people complained against Him, craving meat and rejecting His provision of manna.

faq.question: How did God help Moses with leadership?
faq.answer: He empowered seventy elders with the Spirit to help share the leadership burden.
